p: Data about COVID-19 in patients with diabetes is limited at present. Diabetes was present in 42.3% of 26 fatalities due to COVID-19 in Wuhan, China [ 8]. In a study in 140 patients with COVID-19 in Wuhan, China, diabetes was not a risk factor for severe disease course [ 9]. However, another study in 150 patients (68 deaths and 82 recovered patients) in Wuhan showed that the number of co-morbidities to be a significant predictor of mortality [ 10]. Analysis of 11 studies regarding laboratory abnormalities in patients with COVID-19 did not mention raised blood glucose or diabetes as predictor of severe disease [ 11]. Notwithstanding these small series, a report of 72,314 cases of COVID-19 published by Chinese Centre for Disease Control and Prevention showed increased mortality in people with diabetes (2.3%, overall and 7.3%, patients with diabetes) [ 12].
